title: hello - can anyone recommend a good online printer?
content:
Im makin biz cards.  
Thanks, have a gooday
author: efratyar

comments.content:
if you want it cheap, you can use vista or uprinting  
 [http://www.vistaprint.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/www.vistaprint.com/ "http://www.vistaprint.com")  
 [http://www.uprinting.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/www.uprinting.com/ "http://www.uprinting.com")

but I do recommend some printers here in new york. Sure it will coast 10% more, but you will be helping out your local printing industry.

291digital  
 [http://291digital.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/291digital.com/ "http://291digital.com")

bsquare  
 [http://bsqu.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/bsqu.com/ "http://bsqu.com")

mynational  
 [http://mynational.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/mynational.net/ "http://mynational.net")
@jwchen, by the way, do you know any printers that could silk-screen a business card ?

@apankrat  
sorry, I've never printed anything on silk screen so your guess is as good as mine.

Rnt ur makin spam postz?

Joe Clark  
 [http://joeclark.org/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131053812/http:/joeclark.org/ "http://joeclark.org/")

modernpostcard.com

you can't beat their quality and customer service.

Jacky: By Joe? Maybe. By Typophile. No.

I'll let you know if I see something that breaks the rules.

\> wait, am I under suspicion?

If it is only by Joe, then don't sweat it.
